Package io.cyborgcode.roa.db.hooks

Interface DbHookFlow<T extends Enum<T>>

Type Parameters:
T - the enum type used to identify hook implementations
public interface DbHookFlow<T extends Enum<T>>
Defines a single database hook implementation to run custom logic before or after all tests in a class

Each DbHookFlow provides:

  • a flow consumer that accepts the DatabaseService, a shared parameters map, and the hook arguments, and
  • an associated enum constant identifying this hook.

  • Method Details

    • flow

      org.apache.logging.log4j.util.TriConsumer<io.cyborgcode.roa.db.service.DatabaseService,Map<Object,Object>,String[]> flow()
      Returns the executable hook logic.

      The returned TriConsumer is invoked for each hook with:

      • a DatabaseService instance for database operations,
      • a mutable Map into which the hook may write outputs, and
      • an array of String arguments defined on the @DbHook annotation.
      Returns:
      a three-argument consumer executing the hook flow

    • enumImpl

      T enumImpl()
      Returns the enum constant that identifies this hook implementation.

      This value is matched against the type attribute of the @DbHook annotation during reflective lookup to find the correct hook flow.

      Returns:
      the enum identifying this hook
